turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: Remember?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No! That was years ago! I've lived years since then.

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: It's all been a dream.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No! The army did this to me! They've done something to my brain.  Jezzie! I want my boys! Sarah! I'm not dead! I want my family!

turns.speaker: "DOCTOR"
turns.text: Dream on!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No! Oh God.

turns.speaker: DELLA
turns.text: Go on Jake. She reads 'em like a book.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No, thanks.

turns.speaker: DELLA
turns.text: It's fun.

turns.speaker: DELLA
turns.text: Hiya Jake. That was some dance.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Della?

turns.speaker: DELLA
turns.text: You want to see me? Well, here I am.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: DELLA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Just to see you. That's all.

turns.speaker: DELLA
turns.text: Well, how do I look?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Like Della.

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: Dr. Singer. It's been a long time.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hello, Sam.

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: Do you want some help? I can call upstairs.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No, don't. But thanks.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: By who? Why? Paul didn't have an enemy in the world.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Hey, you're talkin' about Paul. Who'd want to hurt him?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Something weird is going on here. What is it about us? Even in Nam it was always weird. Are we all crazy or something?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah, ever since that ...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Grass never did that to me.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: You know, I've been to three shrinks and a hypnotist. Nothing penetrates that night. Nothing.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Too late. I've tried. I think you're right, Jake. I'm game.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: ELI
turns.text: Daddy!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh God!

turns.speaker: ELI
turns.text: You're hurting me!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Stop!!!!

turns.speaker: ELI
turns.text: Daddy. Let go.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: ELI
turns.text: LET GO!

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You have an unusual hand.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I could have told you that.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You see this line here? It's your life line. Here's where you were born. And this is where you got married. You're a married man, huh? Oh oh. Nope. Divorce. See this split.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: You know, you got a strange line here.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's short, huh?

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: Short? It's ended.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh, terrific.

turns.speaker: ELSA
turns.text: It's not funny. According to this ... you're already dead.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Just my luck.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What did he talk about when you guys went out? Did he say anything?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He was upset. He thought people were following him.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Frank. It's Jake. Jacob SInger.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Listen, I just got a strange call from Geary. He said the guys backed down. What's he talking about?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: That's right. We did.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What does that mean, Frank? I don't get it. Why?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's hard to explain.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Well, try, huh.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I don't know if I can. It's just that war is war. Things happen.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Things happen? What the fuck are you talking about? They did something to us, Frank. We have to expose this.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: There's nothing to expose.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jesus Christ! Who's been talking to you?  What's going on? How can you just turn away?  What about the others?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: They're not interested, Jake.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Shit! You know it's not half the case if I go it alone. We're all suffering the same symptoms, Frank. The army is to blame. They've done something to us. How can you not want to know?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Maybe it's not the army, Jake.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Maybe there's a larger truth.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Maybe the demons are real.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Goddamn it. What kind of bullshit is that?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Listen, Jake. I gotta go.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What the hell? What kind of mumbo jumbo ... ?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm hanging up.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hey, wait!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't bother to call again, okay?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Daddy, what was that noise?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Gabe?  What are you doing ... ?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: There was a bang.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It was the window.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: It's cold.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Tell your mother.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Mom, it's ...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Wait ... Daddy.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Don't go.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't go?  I'm not going anywhere. I'm right here, Gabe.  Come on, go back to sleep. You can still get a couple of hours.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Singer, but do you have any idea how many people come to me with the injustices of the world? It'd break your heart.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: This isn't injustice, Mr. Geary. The army did something to us and we've got to find out what.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: The army. The army. What is it with you guys? We're not talking about a trip to the library here. This is the United States Government for God's sake. This is red tape coming out of your ass. You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Exactly. And we need someone to cut through it. We hear you're the man.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: Oh yeah? What am I - Perry Mason here?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Doctor.  Ph.D.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: Ah! I thought you were a mailman.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: Then why aren't you teaching? Why aren't you in a university?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm too messed up to teach.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: Ah! Well then, they're going to have to pay for that, aren't they?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Who's been talking to you? The army? Have they been talking to you, huh?

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: Nobody's been talking to nobody. You don't have a case, you hear me? It's pure and simple. Now leave me alone. Okay?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Listen, will you listen? They're trying to get me. They're comin' out of the walls. The army's done something to me. I need you.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: You need ... a doctor.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: A doctor? And what's he gonna do, tell me I'm crazy? They've fucked with my head. I've got to prove it. You've got to do something.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: You mind? I'm eating, huh?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Something's going on here. You're not telling me something. What the hell's gotten into you?

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: I'll tell you what's gotten into me. I don't know you from Adam, right? You come to my office with this bizarro story and demand I look into it. Okay. I said I'd check it out and I did. Now I don't know what kind of fool you take me for, but you have used and abused me, and I don't like it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Used you?

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: I talked to the Army's Bureau of Records. You've never even been to Viet Nam.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: It means that you and your buddies are whacko, that you were discharged on psychological grounds after some war games in Thailand.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: War games? Thailand? That's not true! How can you believe that? Can't you see what they're doing? It's all a lie. We were in Da Nang, for God's sake. You've got to believe me.

turns.speaker: GEARY
turns.text: I don't have to do any such thing. I'm eating my lunch, okay?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Bullshit. Someone's covering somethin'. That was no accident.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Cars don't explode that way. Any simpleton knows that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: But the paper ...

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: That was set. I'm tellin' you.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: What'd he say that for? What made him say that? Strange, huh? Strange.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What else did he say, Jake?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What do you mean, demons?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He told me he was going to Hell.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He was scared. He saw these creatures coming out of the woodwork. They were tryin' to get him, he said.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: How long had that been going on?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: A couple of weeks, I think.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He say what they looked like?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. Not really ...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Excuse me a minute. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You think they're connected?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I think something's fucking connect- ed. I mean, a car tried to run me over the other day. Doug too, right? We've got six guys here going fucking crazy.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: It's not worth goin' over again and again. Whatever happened, happened. It's over.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: ... I've seen them, too.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Dr. Carlson's dead?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: An explosion, just like Paul's.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Not me, buddy.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Okay, not you Rod. But the rest of us are flipping out for some goddamn reason. They're tryin' to kill us. Fuck it man, we need to find out what's going on.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Come on, Professor. The army's not gonna give you any answers. You'll be buttin' your head against a stone wall.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Maybe that's the only way to get through. Besides, six heads'll be better than one.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Not my head, buddy. Not me. I'm gettin' a headache just listenin' to you.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: We should get ourselves a lawyer.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: I say you should get a shrink.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Come on, Jake. That didn't hurt.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I know you. How come you're so tense today?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What can I tell you?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I saw Sarah the other day.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Her knee acting up?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: A bit.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What did she have to say?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Turn on your right side.  How about the other "right?"  I don't understand you philosphers. You've got the whole world figured out but you can't remember the difference between right and left.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I was absent the day they taught that in school. What did she say?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Sarah.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Not much. She's like you that way. Two clams. No wonder your marriage didn't last. Put your hand under your head. Take a breath and then let it out.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Ah, good. Now turn to your left.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She talk about the boys?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: She says she can't get them new coats because you haven't sent the alimony for three months.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She told you that?  Did she tell you about the $2,000 I'm still paying for the orthodontist? I'll bet she didn't mention that.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: She said you were a son of a bitch and she regrets the day she set eyes on you.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I thought you said she didn't say much.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: She didn't. That's about all she said. Put your hand up. Good. I think she still loves you. Take a breath and let it out.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Loves me!? She hasn't said a kind word about me in years!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Right. She doesn't stop talking about you. You're always on her mind. That's love, Jake.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She hates me, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You should go back to her.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What? She threw me out, remember. She wanted some professor to carry her far away from Brooklyn. Only we didn't make it. She can't forgive me that she still lives in the same house she grew up in.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Her problem is that you spent eight years getting a PhD and then went to work for the post office.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What can I tell you, Louis? After Nam I didn't want to think anymore. I decided my brain was too small an organ to comprehend this chaos.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: If it was any other brain but yours, I might agree. Relax, this is going to be strong.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I can't relax.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Wiggle your toes.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: God almighty. What did you do to me?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I had to get in there. A deep adjustment. Rest a moment and let it set a bit.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I had this weird flash just then.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know. I've been having them recently.  You know, you look like an angel, Louis, an overgrown cherub. Anyone ever tell you that?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yeah. You. Every time I see you. No more Errol Flynn, okay? Your back won't take it. You tell your girl friend to calm down if she knows what's good for you.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Louis, you're a life saver.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Half an hour from now and you'll be walking out of here all by yourself. Mark my words.  Well, you've done it to yourself this time, haven't you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Am I dead, Louis?  Am I dead?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: From a slipped disc? That'd be a first.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I was in Hell. I've been there. It's horrible. I don't want to die, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Well, I'll see what I can do about it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I've seen it. It's all pain.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You ever read Meister Eckart?  How did you ever get your Doctorate without reading Eckart?  Good. Okay, let's turn over gently. Right side.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Perfect. We got it.  Okay. Let's just give it a little try. See if you can stand.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What? By myself?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You can do it. Come on. Easy. Just give it a try.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: There's something I've gotta take care of, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What are you talking about? You can barely stand.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm walking, aren't I?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Jake, you need to rest.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Not tonight, Louis. No more rest.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Are you in the service?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: The postal service. I'm a mailman.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Ah. Neither snow nor sleet, nor dark of night ... I always admired that.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Likewise.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: And how is your wife? Sarah, no?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I haven't seen her in months.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Ah!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm with another woman now. We're both with the post office, Midtown, 34th Street branch.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Hmm. I don't suppose there are too many philosophers in the post office?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh, you'd be surprised. They just don't have their doctorates, that's all.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Last I heard you were offered a posi- tion in the West somewhere. Tuscon was it?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh, that goes way back. They had a hiring freeze, one of those last min- ute things. Bad timing for me though. Middle of the war. The draft.  I'll tell you Prof, after Viet Nam ... I didn't want to think anymore. I decided my brain was just too small an organ to comprehend this chaos.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Jacob, if it was any other brain but yours, I might agree.  Tell me, does your lady friend know what a brilliant thinker, what a sub- lime intellect she's living with?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I doubt it's my mind that interests her. I tell you Prof, she's a fiery lady.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Well, try not to get burned. You have a great mind, Jacob. Don't let anyone tempt you away from it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I've got a problem, Prof. More Augus- tine than Kierkegaard, if you know what I mean.  I need to know about ... demons.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Demons, Jacob? Why demons? Are you writing ... ?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No.  I see them.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: See them?  What do you mean? Physically?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: I know very little about demons, Ja- cob, fleshy ones anyway. I know them as literary figures, biblical ones ... Dante, Milton ... but Jacob,  this is the 20th Century. We don't see demons now.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I see them, Prof. Everywhere. They're invading my life.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Christ, I know how it sounds.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Have you considered a doctor? A psy- chiatrist?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yes.  I don't want them. I'm not looking for analysis or drugs. It's too easy to dismiss as some kind of psychosis.  It's more than that. I can feel it. I need you Prof. You're the only one I can talk to.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I need your insight, your intuition.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Demons? I don't know what to tell you. It sounds like a spiritual mat- ter to me. The problem, Jacob, is that you have no context for it. You're a renegade Existentialist suf- fering demons a hundred years after Freud. How the hell am I supposed to make it fit?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm afraid, Prof. Nothing makes sense.  Please help me.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Jacob, I don't believe in demons, not in the empirical sense. I don't be- lieve in devils fighting for our souls. I don't believe in enternal damnation. I don't believe in other- worldly creatures tormenting us. We don't need them. We do a good enough job on ourselves.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: But I see them.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Look. I don't pretend to know what's going on inside your head. For all I know it's pathological and they should be pumping Valium into your veins by the quart. But if you're not willing to accept the help of sci- ence; and believe me, I admire you for that: then you'll have to do bat- tle on your own. What can I say? It's a lonely pilgrimage through our times even for the strongest souls. But to be pursued by ... demons no less ... There are no guides, Jacob.  You wanna know what I'd do if I sud- denly started seeing demons? I'd hail the first taxi that came along, shoot over to Bellvue and beg them for shock treatment. I'm no saint.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hell, you think I am?

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: I'venever understood you, you know that? You were by far the best pupil I've ever had, bar none. Intellectu- ally, you were the most original, the most imaginative. Who knows, maybe you've been "elected" to see demons. Maybe you're in touch with ... some- thing. Nothing would surprise me about you Jacob. Nothing.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'd like to speak to Dr. Carlson, please.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Carlson? Is he new here?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: New? He's been here for years.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Not according to my charts. Do you have an appointment?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Look, I need to see him. I know where his room is. Just give me a pass. I won't be long. Ten minutes.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Our doctors are seen by appointment only.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Damn it. I was in the veteran's out- patient program. He knows me.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jacob Singer.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: I'm sorry but there's no record of a Jacob Singer in our files.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Whataya mean, no record?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: You want me to spell it out? There's nothing here.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: That's ridiculous. I've been coming here for years. Listen to me. I'm going out of my fucking mind here. I need to see him.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: If this is an emergency we have a staff of psychiatric social workers. There's about an hour's wait. I'll be glad to take your name. Why don't you just fill out this form?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Goddamn it! I don't want a social worker. Carlson knows me.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's freezing.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm not cold.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Of course not. You have all the blankets. It must be ten degrees in here. I'm telling you, Sarah, if you want to sleep with fresh air, you sleep on the fire escape. From now on that window is closed.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It's not healthy with it closed.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: This is healthy? I'll probably die of pneumonia tomorrow and this is healthy.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What a dream I was having. I was living with another woman ... You know who it was?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I don't want to know.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jezebel, from the post office. You remember, you met her that time at the Christmas party. I was living with her. God, it was a nightmare. There were all these demons and I was on fire. Only I was burning from ice.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Guilty thoughts. See what happens when you cheat on me, even in your mind?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She was good in bed, though.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Go to sleep.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She had these real beefy thighs. Delicious.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I thought you said it was a nightmare?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm not dead. I am not dead.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: No. Of course you're not. You've just hurt your back. That's all. You're going to be fine. It'll just take some time.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Jacob, what can I do?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Save me!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: My back. I can't move. I need my chiropractor.

turns.speaker: RESIDENT
turns.text: Your back? Did you fall?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: They stole it.

turns.speaker: RESIDENT
turns.text: Who did?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know. Santa Claus. I had my son's picture in it. Gabe's picture. It's the only one I had.

turns.speaker: RESIDENT
turns.text: We better get an orthopedic man in here. Is Dr. Davis on call?

turns.speaker: RESIDENT
turns.text: I'm going to have to move you a bit, just to check for injuries. This may hurt a little.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. Don't move me.

turns.speaker: RESIDENT
turns.text: I don't have to ask if you can feel that.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Goddamn it. I want Louis.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Jake, is that you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What the hell did you do, move all the furniture?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Why didn't you turn on the light?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I didn't want to wake you.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Gee, thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where is the lamp?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: If I knew I wouldn't have to ask. What did you do? I was happy the way it was.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I moved the couch. That's all.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: That help?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: The room!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Oh God, Jezzie, ask me tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It is tomorrow. Four A.M. How come you're so late?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Roberts didn't show up. What could I say? Besides, it's double time.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What happened to you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You up?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. Have you seen my glasses?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Where'd you leave 'em?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Did you look around the headboard?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jezzie, I can't see.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Maybe you left 'em in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Thanks.  What's that?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Your kid dropped it off.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Who? Jed?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: No. The little one.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Eli. Why can't you remember their names?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: They're weird names.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: They're Biblical. They were prophets.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Well, personally, I never went for church names.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: And where do you think Jezebel comes from?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I don't let anybody call me that.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You're a real heathen, you know that, Jezzie? Jesus, how did I ever get involved with such a ninny?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You sold your soul, remember? That's what you told me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yeah, but for what?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: A good lay.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: And look what I got.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: The best.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I must have been out of my head.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Jake, you are never out of your head!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's in here?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Pictures. Your wife was gonna toss 'em so "what's his name" brought 'em over on his way to school.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Look at these, will ya? I don't believe it. Jesus, these are fantastic. Look, here's my Dad ... And here's my brother, when we were down in Florida.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Lemme see.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Here. Look. This is me and Sarah when I was still at City College.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: That's Sarah?  I can see what you mean.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Why you left.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What do you mean you can see?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Look at her face. A real bitch.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: She looked good then.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Not to me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Well, you didn't marry her.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Is that the one who died?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Gabe.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Wait. Don't.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I don't like things that make you cry.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I just want to look ...

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Just gettin' rid of the garbage.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Jake!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How's it going?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm going home.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't know. One of these days, I'm gonna see Louis. My back's killing me.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Now? What about the boss? He's not gonna like it.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Well, I'll miss riding home with you. I was looking forward to it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'll be glad to avoid the crush.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I enjoy crushing into you.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Maybe it's all the pressure, Jake. The money. Things like that. Or your wife.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Why do you bring her up?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: 'Cause she's always on your mind.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: When was the last time I said a word?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It has nothin' to do with talkin'.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's still there, Jake.  Even if you never say a word about it. You can't spend two years in Vietnam ...

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What does that have to do with anything? Does it explain the barricaded subway stations? Does it explain those Godforsaken creatures?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: New York is filled with creatures. Everywhere. And lots of stations are closed.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: They're like demons, Jez.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Demons, Jake? Come on. They're winos and bag ladies. Low life. That's all they are. The streets are crawling with 'em. Don't make em into somethin' they're not.  It's the pressure, honey. That's all it is.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Those guys tried to kill me tonight. They were aiming right at me.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Kids on a joy ride. Happens all the time.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: They weren't human!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Come on. What were they, Jake?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I wanna leave. Get me out of here.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Oh, come on. It's early.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: We're at Della's.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What do you mean? Where do you think?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where's Della? Bring her here?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Why? What for?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Show me Della!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Hey, I'm here.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Can't you stop it?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: If I could stop it, I'd stop it.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's it say? A hundred and two?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I don't believe this. I'm calling the doctor.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's gone to the top.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: How high is that?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: The numbers stop at 107.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What the hell are you doin'?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Get your clothes off.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What are you talking about? I'm freezing.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Get your clothes off!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What'd the doctor say?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: That you'd die on the way to the hospital. Now get into that tub.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: He's coming right over.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Coming here?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Goddamn it. Get in here. I can't stand around waiting.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You're out of your mind. I'm not getting in there. I'd rather die.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: That's your decision.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Look at me. I'm ice cold.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You're red hot, damn it. Get in there. I've got to get more ice.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I can't do it.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What kind of man are you?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't gimme that.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Lie down!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jezzie! My feet are throbbing!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Sam, Tony, come in here.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Hey, I'm not dressed.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Help me! Help me!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Here. I'll do it.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Jake.  You're gonna be all right, Jake. You're gonna be fine.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Am I home?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You're here. Home. The doctor said you're lucky your brains didn't boil.  What a night, Jake. It was crazy. You kept sayin' "Sarah, close the window," over and over. And talkin' to your kids. Even the dead one. Weird. You know you melted 200 pounds of ice in 8 hours. Amazing, huh?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Are we in Brooklyn?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You're right here, Jake. You just rest.  The doctor said you had a virus. That's what they say when they don't know what it is. You can't do anything for a week. He says you gotta recuperate.  Now you just lie here. Mrs. Sandelman made you some chicken soup. It'll warm you up.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You know, you really ought to get out today. You can't just sit around like this all the time. It's not healthy. It's not good for your mind. Go take a walk, or somethin'. Go to a movie. Christ, who's gonna know? You think I care? I don't give a shit. Go. Enjoy yourself. One of us should be having a good time.  Hello! Anybody home?  Anybody in there?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Look, I'm horny. Keep it in mind.  Love me a little?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You are the most unbelievable woman I have ever met. One second you're a screaming banshee and the next you're Florence Nightingale. Who are you? That's what I want to know. Will the real Jezzie Pipkin please stand up.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: So tell me ... am I still an angel?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: With wings. You transport me, you know that? You carry me away.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: We're all angels, you know ...  ... and devils. It's just what you choose to see.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I love you, Jez.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Underneath all the bullshit, just love.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Remember that.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You know what? I feel ... exorcised ... like the demons are gone.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: How come? The army?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: In a way. At least now I have some idea of what was happening. If we can only get them to admit ... to explain what they did ... I don't know. Maybe it'd clear things up in my head. I'll tell you something, Jez, honestly ... I thought they were real.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I put a frozen dinner in the oven, a Manhandler. It'll be ready at a quarter of. I threw a little salad together. It's in the fridge. I also bought some apple juice, Red Cheek. Don't drink it all. Oh, and Jake, your lawyer called.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: He did? When?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: While you were in the shower.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Why didn't you call me?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: He didn't give me a chance.  Look, honey, don't get upset, but he's not taking your case.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What? What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: He said you didn't have one.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's he talking about?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I don't know. That's all he said. He wasn't very friendly. Oh, yeah. He said your buddies backed down. They chickened out, he said.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I don't believe this.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Baby, I'm sorry. I feel terrible. I'd stay and talk but I'm so late. Look, don't be upset. We'll talk when I get home. See you around midnight.  Bye. And don't brood. Watch T.V. or something.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's just me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Jezzie?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Who else were you expecting?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Let go!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Where were you, Jake? Where've you been? Why haven't you called?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Stay away from me, Jez.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I want to know. You tell me!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: You wanna know? Turn on the T.V. Watch the fucking news!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me? You can't just go away like that.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I can do anything I want.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Don't!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It might be for me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm not here. You haven't seen me.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Hello ... No. He's not here. I haven't seen him all night ... I don't know when ... What? Tell him what?  Vietnam? ... What experiments?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: A chemist. Part of a chemical warfare unit out of Saigon. He said he knows me and that I'll know him when I see him.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I have no idea.  I was right. There were experiments. I knew it. I knew it. My God.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: How do you know he's telling the truth?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What are you doing here? Are you all right? How do you expect to pay for this?  Everyone's looking for you, Jake. I dodged people all over the place, reporters, police. I don't know what you're gonna do.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I'm gonna make love to you. That's what I'm gonna do.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Yep. Finally. I love you, Jez.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: God, I can't keep up with all your changes.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Me neither.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What's gotten into you?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's amazing, you know, that a drug could change things like that, destroy a life and then give it back. It's hard to believe that the world could be so hellish on day and like heaven the next.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I tell you, it was so wonderful. I felt like a little boy. I saw Paradise, Jezzie.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's so hard to believe.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: This is one of my dreams, Jake. Ever since I was a little girl. I never thought it would happen.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Stick with me, kid.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I want to go with you, Jake. Wherever you go.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: It's not practical, Jez. It'll be hard enough alone.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: I can waitress. I'm good.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. Things are too hot. Later. I'll send for you.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Bullshit!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I promise.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No. I'm a marked man, Jez. I'm the only one left. I don't want to expose you to that. It's not right for you or me. Be reasonable.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Reasonable? Reasonable? Jake ... You're gettin' me angry.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: I love you when you're angry.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Try leavin' without me.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What're you ... ? Where's Sarah? Where are the boys?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Sit down, Jake.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Sit down.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: No! What's going on? Where's my family?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: It's over, Jake. It's all over.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Where have they gone?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Wake up. Stop playing with yourself. It's finished.

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: Your capacity for self-delusion is remarkable, Dr. Singer.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: What's wrong, Jake?  Forget to take your antidote?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: Who are you? What are you doing to me?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: You have quite a mind, Jake. I loved your friends. That chemist - the Ladder. What an imagination you have!

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: WHO ARE YOU?

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: How many times have you asked me that? How many times?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: TELL ME, DAMN YOU!

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: YOU KNOW WHO I AM.

turns.speaker: JEZZIE
turns.text: So tell me ... am I still an angel?

turns.speaker: JACOB
turns.text: With wings.  You transport me, you know that? You carry me away.
